title: NeedSupply.com sans serif typeface?
content:
Dear type gurus,

Does anyone know the name of the font used by Need Supply ( [http://needsupply.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415133125/http:/needsupply.com/ "http://needsupply.com")) on all there hero images on their home page. It's a sans serif, and I just can't pick it.

Any help is appreciated.

Font: 

 No
author: glyph

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415133125im_/http:/typophile.com/files/needsuply_5125.jpg)

Here is a sample of the typeface I'm trying to identify. Thanks again.

Can't find a match either. Firstly thought to [Sofia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415133125/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mostardesign/sofia-pro) by Mostardesign Olivier Gourvat but /G and /M thrown me off. Then thought to KLIM Kris Sowersby [Metric](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415133125/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fklim.co.nz/retail-fonts/metric) but still /M and /S off... May be a custom typeface?

I thought it might be custom, but I'd be surprised if it was (in a good way). It's not the usual modern-geo-sans-serif suspects. Not the terminals on characters such as the G, W and the equal width upper counter on the S.
